medical_history.chief_complaint: Growth retardation, delayed bone development, and constipation in a 12-year-old girl due to a heterozygous mutation in TR /H92511.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 6 years of age when LT4 treatment was started due to hypothyroid symptoms. Initial symptoms included growth retardation and constipation, which improved with LT4 treatment. When LT4 was stopped temporarily at age 11, symptoms like constipation worsened, with stool frequency decreasing to every 2-3 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient has a heterozygous single-nucleotide insertion in exon 9 of THRA, causing growth retardation and delayed cognitive and motor skills. The father received LT4 treatment starting at 42 years of age.
medical_history.family_history: Father has a similar genetic mutation and associated low thyroid function symptoms. He has acquired hearing loss, likely due to otosclerosis.
